MOSCOW , May 19 ( RIA Novosti ) - Settling the crisis in Ukraine is impossible without Russia 's assistance , Slovak Foreign Minister Miroslav Lajčák said Monday .

We are sure that solving the situation and stabilizing the situation in Ukraine is impossible without the active participation of the Russian Federation , Lajčák said during a joint press conference with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Moscow .
Lajčák called for settling the crisis in Ukraine through political means .

A0: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Moscow
RelatedSentence: Lavrov said Russia and Slovakia have a common understanding that violence should be stopped in Ukraine and comprehensive dialogue involving all Ukrainian regions is needed in the country .

The sides agree that even amid the deteriorated situation in Europe there is a need to continue working on expanding areas of cooperation , the Russian foreign minister said .
